resources.string: Used to hide or show a Composable element.\nYou can customize the transition by specifying EnterTransition and ExitTransition.\nThis example shows the animation when an element appears and disappears using a TweenSpec

Crossfade animates between two layouts with a chaining animation. If you toggle the heat being passed to the current parameter, the content is changed with a chaining animation.\nIn this example, the animation is shown when increasing or decreasing the number, as well as changing the background color

This composable element animates its content as it changes based on a target state.\nThis example is going to be separated into two parts, one to show the use of SizeTransform (Customizing how a component resizes when expand) and the other to show the use of ContentTransform (Using Enter/ExitTransitions to animate the appearance and disappearance of elements)

The animateContentSize modifier animates a size change, it should be used before another size modifier to ensure correct operation.\nThe following example consists of expanding and collapsing a container to see more lines of text of a description using the chosen animation
